text: If the XY problem means asking question Y while actually needing info about X, then the PQ problem is the complementary situation when someone answers question Q even though P was asked, because the responder only knows something about Q.

elements.text: If the XY problem means asking question Y while actually needing info about X, then the PQ problem is the complementary situation when someone answers question Q even though P was asked, because the responder only knows something about Q.

text: This hit me deep. I suffer from the PQ problem regularly :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: This hit me deep. I suffer from the PQ problem regularly

text: Thats why I hang out here, people have really good answers for things

elements.text: Thats why I hang out here, people have really good answers for things

text: My PQ answer to any question of the type “how can I make my Python/Numpy code faster” is “rewrite it in Julia!”

elements.text: My PQ answer to any question of the type “how can I make my Python/Numpy code faster” is “rewrite it in Julia!”
